newsitem.title: USA: Florida advances bill to raise school building tax.
newsitem.headline: Florida advances bill to raise school building tax.

text.p: Florida's Senate Education Committee has approved a bill raising the millage rate limit on property taxes school districts can levy for construction.

The proposal (SB1434) was approved Tuesday and raises the limit to 2.5 mills from 2 mills, an increase of 50 cents per $1,000 of assessed value. The bill is sponsored by Sen. Buddy Dyer, D-Orlando, and is the first of several competing school construction funding bills to see any action in the legislature.
A recent report by the Governor's Commission on Education said Florida needs $3 billion of construction to meet current enrollment needs.
